title: Function behavior from tabular values of function

content.question: If f is twice-differentiable on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following statements could be true?

choices.label: f' is negative and decreasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f' is negative and increasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f' is positive and decreasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f' is positive and increasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

content.answer: f' is negative and increasing for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
